alert.note: Alert for Southeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 24 at 7:56AM EDT until September 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, locally one to two feet of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront of western Peconic Bay. * WHERE...Southeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Monday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 PM EDT this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Minor to locally moderate flooding of the more vulnerable locations for western portions of Peconic Bay, mainly in the vicinity of Riverhead. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Life- threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * BEACH EROSION AND FLOODING IMPACTS...Large breaking waves of 6 to 10 ft will cause beach flooding and erosion, with scattered areas of dune erosion during the time of high tide. The potential for localized overwashes is low at this time, limited to the most compromised dune areas. * SWIMMING IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions. Life-threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of minor coastal flooding are possible into this week, particularly during the afternoon/evening high tides for Monday and Tuesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.
